question: Where is Petra, an archaeological site with rock-cut architecture and designated a World Heritage Site 1985, that was built by the Nabataeans as their capital city around 100 BC?
api_result: Petra is located in southern Jordan. It is renowned for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, and it was established as the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom around 100 BC. Petra was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1985 and is one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world.
